p: The results of a recent meta-analysis of nine studies showed that the IL-6 levels were significantly increased in COVID-19-infected patients with severe conditions (SMD = 0.71, 95%CI –0.31 to 1.12, p = 0.0005) ( 25). Ruan and colleagues showed the elevated level of IL-6 in critically ill individuals with COVID-19 ( 26). Similarly, other reports also established the increased level of IL-6 in patients with confirmed COVID-19 pneumonia and it has been shown that the level of IL-6 has a positive correlation with the severity of the disease ( 4, 27, 28).
